intro: Perezia scalpellifolia var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved perezia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
